title: CSSCombinatorsReference

metadata.description: Learn about CSSCombinatorsReference with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
CSS Combinators A combinator is a sign that explains the relationship between selectors. The table below shows the different combinators in CSS: Name Sign Example Example Result Child combinator > div > p Selects every

element that are direct children of a

element Descendant combinator (single space) div p Selects all

elements inside

elements Namespace separator | ns | h2 Selects all

elements in namespace ns + div + p Selects the first

element that is placed immediately after

elements Selector list , div, p Selects all
elements and all

elements Subsequent-sibling combinator ~ p ~ ul Selects all

    elements that are preceded by a

    element ★ +1

practice_exercises.title: Practice Exercise
practice_exercises.description: Create an example that applies the concepts from this tutorial.

summary: This tutorial covers CSSCombinatorsReference concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use CSSCombinatorsReference effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of CSSCombinatorsReference and how to apply it in your projects.
